links.title: Red-tailed Hawk Sounds, All About Birds, Cornell Lab of Ornithology
links.description: This is probably the most common hawk in North America. If you‚Äôve got sharp eyes you‚Äôll see several individuals on almost any long car ride, anywhere. Red-tailed Hawks soar above open fields, slowly turning circles on their broad, rounded wings. Other times you‚Äôll see them atop telephone poles, eyes fixed on the ground to catch the movements of a vole or a rabbit, or simply waiting out cold weather before climbing a thermal updraft into the sky.

links.description: The Bald Eagle has been the national emblem of the United States since 1782 and a spiritual symbol for native people for far longer than that. links.title: How to create a 1M record table with a single query
links.description: Let‚Äôs say you want to check how a query behaves on a large table - but there is no such table at hand. This is not a problem if your DBMS supports SQL recursion: lots of data can be generated with a single query. The WITH RECURSIVE clause comes to the rescue.
links.original_title: How to create a 1M record table with a single query

links.title: The generate_series Table-Valued Function
links.description:
The generate_series(START,END,STEP) table-valued function is a
loadable extension included in the SQLite source tree, and compiled into
the command-line shell.  The generate_series() table has a single
result column named "value" holding integer values
and a number of rows determined by the
parameters START, END, and STEP.  The first row of the table has
a value of START.  Subsequent rows increase by STEP up to END.
